config.question: What error did Wilson make in the days leading up to the peace conference following World War I?

choices.content: He appealed to voters to elect a Democratic Congress, alienating Republican supporters.
He included powerful Republican senators in his delegation to the peace conference.
He appointed ex-President Taft to his delegation to the peace conference, diluting his control.
He helped his party wrest control of both the House and the Senate, destroying any hopes of bipartisan support.

answer_3.response: Wilson made a grave error just before the peace conference began. He appealed to voters to elect a Democratic Congress in November 1918, saying that any other result would be “interpreted on the other side of the water as a repudiation of my leadership.” Republicans were furious, especially those who had supported the Fourteen Points; Wilson’s problems deepened when the Democrats lost both the House and Senate.
